text:
Hi all,
I'm trying to show the image loading selection as well as the 'size_type' with this field object.

```const imageField: ImageFieldType = {
  name: 'image_2',
  type: 'image',
  label: 'Image',
  required: true,
  showLoading: true,
  default: {
    src: '<https://placehold.co/600x400>',
    width: 600,
    height: 400,
    loading: 'lazy',
  },
};```
However, it's not showing in the (see screenshot).

What do I do wrong here?
Is it even possible to use a module/island for hubdb dynamic driven pages with single page routing and pagination with cms-react? <@UCY83QS6Q> <@UAYBXDG4U>
Wait, is this about building HubSpot Sites/themes with React?
What are the caveats and how is performance+seo
Did read the docs. Quite awesome since you will be rendering on the server (only interactive stuff will be client side. Recommended for production?

Hi <@U06RG08JFU4>, seems the issue is wider, if we are using `cms-react` with server-side rendering with islands, when open a page with private window in Firefox, all the islands are not rendered, because the runtime js is blocked by firefox I guess ..
@ HubSpot team, is there anything we can do solve the issue or have the scripts change the domain ?

some page examples
